newsitem.title: UK: Enterprise, Lasmo track U.S oil shares down.
newsitem.headline: Enterprise, Lasmo track U.S oil shares down.

text.p: Shares in British oil companies retreated on Tuesday in reponse to overnight profit-taking in U.S. oil stocks and a fall in the price of crude, traders said.
By 0904 GMT, Enterprise Oil was 9-1/2p weaker at 625 while Lasmo Plc was down four pence at 247.
British Petroleum fell seven pence to 710 and Shell eased six pence to 10.225 stg.
U.S. oil shares were hit by broad profit-taking after crude prices slipped on the New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX) in a technical sell-off, U.S. traders said.

"U.S. oil shares came back a lot overnight and the oil price is easier and well off its recent levels," one market-maker said. "Oil shares have had a good run in both the U.S. and the UK and it's no surprise to see them come back a bit."
